jervis.tools
[Groovy] Class scmGit

java.lang.Object
  jervis.tools.scmGit

class scmGit
extends Object

A class to provide useful functions for interacting with a local git repository.

Sample usage

import jervis.tools.scmGit
def x = new scmGit()
print "Git root dir: "
println x.getRoot()

Property Summary
String git_root

Stores the root directory of the git repository when the class is instantiated or setRoot() is called.

String mygit

The default git command to be used when executing git commands.

 
Constructor Summary
scmGit()

Upon instantiation calls the setRoot() function to set the git_root property.
scmGit(String git)

Instantiates a custom git path and calls the setRoot() function to set the git_root property.
 
Method Summary
String getRoot()

@return The value of git_root which is a known directory of the git repository in the current working directory of when the scmGit class was instantiated.
void setRoot()

Gets the root directory of a repository and stores in in git_root.

 
Methods inherited from class Object
wait, wait, wait, equals, toString, hashCode, getClass, notify, notifyAll
 

Property Detail

git_root

String git_root
Stores the root directory of the git repository when the class is instantiated or setRoot() is called. Default: ""

mygit

String mygit
The default git command to be used when executing git commands. Default: "git"

 
Constructor Detail

scmGit

scmGit()
Upon instantiation calls the setRoot() function to set the git_root property.

scmGit

scmGit(String git)
Instantiates a custom git path and calls the setRoot() function to set the git_root property.
Parameters:
git - A path to a git executable.

 
Method Detail

getRoot

String getRoot()
Returns:
The value of git_root which is a known directory of the git repository in the current working directory of when the scmGit class was instantiated.

setRoot

void setRoot()
Gets the root directory of a repository and stores in in git_root. It is the equivalent of executing the following git command. 
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
